amendment.description: Amendment clarifies that any independent counsel appointed under title 28 of the United States Code and any employee of such independent counsel is covered under title 8 of the bill which establishes ethical standards for Federal prosecutors.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to include any independent counsel appointed under title 28, United States Code, in the provisions of Title VIII, Citizens Protection, cited as the "Citizens Protection Act of 1998."

action.text: Mr. Hutchinson raised a point of order against the Conyers amendment (A029). Mr. Hutchinson stated that the Conyers amendment expands the scope and includes new legislative language. Point of order overruled by the Chair.
On agreeing to the Conyers amendment (A029) Agreed to by recorded vote: 249 - 182 (Roll No. 396).
